intro: Diplospora australis, commonly known as the Australian diplospora, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a fragrant aroma. Diplospora australis is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
